授業目的:
授業目的：
　「英語BI」をベースにリスニングとスピーキングの技能をさらに発展させて活かし、ライティングでは段落構成をもとに作文ができるようにする。
　理解できる程度のやや長い文章を含む会話の実践とより範囲が広がった複雑な表現の構文の練習により習得したリスニングとスピーキングの技能をさらに発展させて活かす。
到達目標:
効果的に会話をするために必要とされる社交性も重視し、それをもとに自分自身の履歴、過去の経験を論じ、自分自身の意見を明確に発表し、そして将来の計画についても語ることができるようになる。
　音声面では、音の弱化、同化、省略などの主な連接音を聞き取りまた発話できるようになる。
　ライティングでは主題文と補足文に基づいた適格な段落構成ができるようになる。
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Activities will include discussions, games, peer review of writing assignments, along with online activities.  Students will work in pairs, groups, and individually.

第1回: Course introduction, tense review, along with the discussion topic of this summer.
第2回: Tense review continued; social expressions; what is a paragraph. Written Goals: finding and producing topic sentences.  Performance: telling the class about our apartment game.
Homework handout with the Video “The Wienerlypics”,
第3回: Daily routines; present tenses, Unit 8 cooking. Speaking goals: Describing my day and asking my classmate about theirs. Explaining how to make a dish to my class mates. Written goal creating good supporting sentences for a topic sentence.

Handout; prepare for pg.38 #1; check vocabulary pg.38 #2; pg.39 #4; prepare to do number 5 orally in class with a partner. Listening pg. 40, 10 out of 15;  And first letter telling me about your summer break due.
第4回: P.  Past tenses; time expressions (Unit 12) Ghost story. Goal: Placing an event in a temporal relationship to another event. Written goals creating good supporting sentences for a topic sentence continued
Video: “ Oakley has a date.” Handout
第5回: The class goal is to explain and inquire into different amounts of things both concreate and non-concreate using : Some/any; a few/a little/a lot; Performance: telling the class about our apartment game. Written goal: peer review of writing assignments
第6回: Class goals: to describe your health condition; and to ask others about their condition. Performance: telling the class about our apartment game. Written goal: To proofread and improve sample paragraphs.
第7回:
What something is like? Synonyms and antonyms. Future forms; Goals: to tell a classmate what will happen; and what something or someone is or isn't like. Performance: telling the class about our apartment game.
Mid-Term Oral Examination will be given in lessons 7 and 8, or on line.
第8回:
Goal: Expressing obligations in various situations; and getting medication at a pharmacy or from a doctor.
Oral Exam (Hand out + book in class). Mid-Term Oral Examination will be given in lessons 7 and 8, or on line.
第9回: Goals: Explaining an event or action in  temporal relationships to other events, or actions using time clauses; practicing the uses of manage to/used to; and -ed/-ing adjectives. Performance: telling the class about our apartment game. Written goal: identifying different paragraph purposes.
Handout + Book and one of two videos
第10回: Class goals: distinguishing between the passives and active voice; practicing when to use, and not to use the passive voice. Understanding signs and notices. Performance telling the class about your groups creation.  Written goal: improving the cohesion of your paragraph.
Handout and one of two videos
第11回: Class goals exploring what could happen if an action is, or is not taken; using the second conditional; and practicing phrasal verbs. Performance: telling the class about our apartment game.
Preview Unit 14 plus hand out, and one of two videos
第12回: Present perfect continuous; word formation; and review. Class goal is tell your class mate about your video using the present perfect continuous.
